item.title: Amazon shutting down UGC dungeon brawler King of Meat after six months
item.content:encoded:
Chris Kerr,

Senior Editor, News, GameDeveloper.com

February 24, 2026

1 Min Read

King of Meat is being shut down by publisher Amazon Game Studios and developer Glowmade after just six months. 

The co-op platformer launched on October 2, 2025, but will be laid to rest on April 9, 2026. 

Glowmade said the UGC title—which tasked players with crafting and completing barmy dungeons—failed to find an audience. As a result, the Guildford-based studio will be ending its investment in the project and switching off the King of Meat servers.

It will be possible to access and play all existing content until the shutdown has concluded, although in-app purchases have been disabled. The title has also been pulled from sale. 

All players who purchased King of Meat will receive a full refund in the coming weeks from their platform provider. In most cases, refunds are expected to be processed automatically between February 24 and April 9. 

"We want to sincerely thank every player who supported King of Meat and the wonderful community that formed around it," reads a post on the Glowmade website. 

Related:Ubisoft announces new Assassin's Creed leadership team

"Your enthusiasm, imagination, and feedback have meant the world to us and to the team at Glowmade. We're grateful for Glowmade's partnership and passion throughout this journey and wish them continued success in the future." 

SteamDB estimates King of Meat peaked at 320 concurrent players on Steam around three months ago. It's unclear how the title fared on PlayStation 5 and Xbox Series X | S.

Game Developer has reached out to Glowmade to clarify whether the studio will be impacted by the shutdown.
